g3002.definition: [Λεββαῖος] of uncertain origin; Lebbæus, a Christian

g3003.definition: [λεγεών] of Latin origin; a "legion", i.e. Roman regiment (figuratively)

g3004.definition: [λέγω] a primary verb; properly, to "lay" forth, i.e. (figuratively) relate (in words (usually of systematic or set discourse; whereas {{g2036}} and {{g5346}} generally refer to an individual expression or speech respectively; while {{g4483}} is properly to break silence merely, and {{g2980}} means an extended or random harangue)); by implication, to mean

g3006.definition: [λεῖος] apparently a primary word; smooth, i.e. "level"

g3007.definition: [λείπω] a primary verb; to leave, i.e. (intransitively or passively) to fail or be absent

g3008.definition: [λειτουργέω] from {{g3011}}; to be a public servant, i.e. (by analogy) to perform religious or charitable functions (worship, obey, relieve)

g3009.definition: [λειτουργία] from {{g3008}}; public function (as priest ("liturgy") or almsgiver)

g3010.definition: [λειτουργικός] from the same as {{g3008}}; functional publicly ("liturgic"); i.e. beneficient

g3011.definition: [λειτουργός] from a derivative of {{g2992}} and {{g2041}}; a public servant, i.e. a functionary in the Temple or Gospel, or (genitive case) a worshipper (of God) or benefactor (of man)

g3012.definition: [λέντιον] of Latin origin; a "linen" cloth, i.e. apron

g3014.definition: [λέπρα] from the same as {{g3013}}; scaliness, i.e. "leprosy"

g3015.definition: [λεπρός] from the same as {{g3014}}; scaly, i.e. leprous (a leper)

g3016.definition: [λεπτόν] neuter of a derivative of the same as {{g3013}}; something scaled (light), i.e. a small coin

g3017.definition: [Λευΐ] of Hebrew origin ({{h3878}}); Levi, the name of three Israelites Compare {{g3018}}.

g3018.definition: [Λευΐς] a form of {{g3017}}; Lewis (i.e. Levi), a Christian

g3019.definition: [Λευΐτης] from {{g3017}}; a Levite, i.e. descendant of Levi

g3020.definition: [Λευϊτικός] from {{g3019}}; Levitic, i.e. relating to the Levites

g3025.definition: [ληνός] apparently a primary word; a trough, i.e. wine-vat

g3026.definition: [λῆρος] apparently a primary word; twaddle, i.e. an incredible story

g3030.definition: [λίβανος] of foreign origin ({{h3828}}); the incense-tree, i.e. (by implication) incense itself

g3031.definition: [λιβανωτός] from {{g3030}}; frankincense, i.e. (by extension) a censer for burning it

g3032.definition: [Λιβερτῖνος] of Latin origin; a Roman freedman

g3033.definition: [Λιβύη] probably from {{g3047}}; Libye, a region of Africa

g3035.definition: [λίθινος] from {{g3037}}; stony, i.e. made of stone

g3036.definition: [λιθοβολέω] from a compound of {{g3037}} and {{g906}}; to throw stones, i.e. lapidate

g3037.definition: [λίθος] apparently a primary word; a stone (literally or figuratively)

g3038.definition: [λιθόστρωτος] from {{g3037}} and a derivative of {{g4766}}; stone-strewed, i.e. a tessellated mosaic on which the Roman tribunal was placed

g3039.definition: [λικμάω] from λικμός, the equivalent of λίκνον (a winnowing fan or basket); to winnow, i.e. (by analogy), to triturate

g3040.definition: [λιμήν] apparently a primary word; a harbor Compare {{g2568}}.

g3041.definition: [λίμνη] probably from {{g3040}} (through the idea of nearness of shore); a pond (large or small)

g3042.definition: [λιμός] probably from {{g3007}} (through the idea of destitution); a scarcity of food

g3043.definition: [λίνον] probably a primary word; flax, i.e. (by implication) "linen"

g3046.definition: [λίτρα] of Latin origin (libra); a pound in weight

g3047.definition: [λίψ] probably from λείβω (to pour a "libation"); the south(- west) wind (as bringing rain, i.e. (by extension) the south quarter)

g3048.definition: [λογία] from {{g3056}} (in the commercial sense); a contribution

g3049.definition: [λογίζομαι] middle voice from {{g3056}}; to take an inventory, i.e. estimate (literally or figuratively)

g3054.definition: [λογομαχέω] from a compound of {{g3056}} and {{g3164}}; to be disputatious (on trifles)

g3055.definition: [λογομαχία] from the same as {{g3054}}; disputation about trifles ("logomachy")

g3056.definition: [λόγος] from {{g3004}}; something said (including the thought); by implication, a topic (subject of discourse), also reasoning (the mental faculty) or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, (with the article in John) the Divine Expression (i.e. Christ)

g3060.definition: [λοίδορος] from λοιδός (mischief); abusive, i.e. a blackguard

g3061.definition: [λοιμός] of uncertain affinity; a plague (literally, the disease, or figuratively, a pest)

g3062.definition: [λοιποί] masculine plural of a derivative of {{g3007}}; remaining ones

g3063.definition: [λοιπόν] neuter singular of the same as {{g3062}}; something remaining (adverbially)

g3064.definition: [λοιποῦ] genitive case singular of the same as {{g3062}}; remaining time

g3065.definition: [Λουκᾶς] contracted from Latin ; Lucas, a Christian

g3066.definition: [Λούκιος] of Latin origin; illuminative; Lucius, a Christian

g3068.definition: [λούω] a primary verb; to bathe (the whole person; whereas {{g3538}} means to wet a part only, and {{g4150}} to wash, cleanse garments exclusively)

g3069.definition: [Λύδδα] of Hebrew origin ({{h3850}}); Lydda (i.e. Lod), a place in Palestine

g3070.definition: [Λυδία] properly, feminine of Ludios (of foreign origin) (a Lydian, in Asia Minor); Lydia, a Christian woman

g3071.definition: [Λυκαονία] perhaps remotely from {{g3074}}; Lycaonia, a region of Asia Minor

g3072.definition: [Λυκαονιστί] adverb from a derivative of {{g3071}}; Lycaonistically, i.e. in the language of the Lycaonians

g3073.definition: [Λυκία] probably remotely from {{g3074}}; Lycia, a province of Asia Minor

g3074.definition: [λύκος] perhaps akin to the base of {{g3022}} (from the whitish hair); a wolf

g3075.definition: [λυμαίνομαι] middle voice from a probably derivative of {{g3089}} (meaning filth); properly, to soil, i.e. (figuratively) insult (maltreat)

g3076.definition: [λυπέω] from {{g3077}}; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad

g3078.definition: [Λυσανίας] from {{g3080}} and ἀνία (trouble); grief-dispelling; Lysanias, a governor of Abilene

g3079.definition: [Λυσίας] of uncertain affinity; Lysias, a Roman

g3081.definition: [λυσιτελεῖ] third person singular present indicative active of a derivative of a compound of {{g3080}} and {{g5056}}; impersonally, it answers the purpose, i.e. is advantageous

g3082.definition: [Λύστρα] of uncertain origin; Lystra, a place in Asia Minor

g3083.definition: [λύτρον] from {{g3089}}; something to loosen with, i.e. a redemption price (figuratively, atonement)

g3088.definition: [λύχνος] from the base of {{g3022}}; a portable lamp or other illuminator (literally or figuratively)

g3089.definition: [λύω] a primary verb; to "loosen" (literally or figuratively) Compare {{g4486}}.

g3090.definition: [Λωΐς] of uncertain origin; Lois, a Christian woman

g3091.definition: [Λώτ] of Hebrew origin ({{h3876}}); Lot, a patriarch

g3092.definition: [Μαάθ] probably of Hebrew origin; Maath, an Israelite

g3093.definition: [Μαγδαλά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h4026}}); the tower; Magdala (i.e. Migdala), a place in Palestine

g3094.definition: [Μαγδαληνή] feminine of a derivative of {{g3093}}; a female Magdalene, i.e. inhabitant of Magdala

g3097.definition: [μάγος] of foreign origin ({{h7248}}); a Magian, i.e. Oriental scientist; by implication, a magician

g3098.definition: [Μαγώγ] of Hebrew origin ({{h4031}}); Magog, a foreign nation, i.e. (figuratively) an Antichristian party

g3099.definition: [Μαδιάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h4080}}); Madian (i.e. Midian), a region of Arabia

g3100.definition: [μαθητεύω] from {{g3101}}; intransitively, to become a pupil; transitively, to disciple, i.e. enrol as scholar
